page.title: 05Lactation Time.
page.content: The busiest time for Mr. Kynaston is in May.This means they have had calves and are producing more milk for them.So they have to be milked three times a day,at 6 o'clock a.m. ,3 o'clock p.m. and 10 o'clock p.m.They have five lactations in a life time. If a bull is born it is fattened up for a year and then sold to be slaughtered for meat.If a dairy cow is born it will be added to the herd and kept for milking. The milk is sold to Express Dairies at Ruyton XI Towns.Mr. Kynaston is paid between 11-17 pence per litre of milk. The farm is quite large consisting of four hundred acres.
